section.simpara: Starts the Zaptel ISDN Remote Access Server.
Starts an ISDN RAS Server using pppd on the current channel. The channel must be available (i.e. PRI Source) and a Zap channel. There is no modem emulation.

The point-to-point daemon pppd must be configured to recognize a Zap interface. The args are a "|" delimited list of parameters. The list is long and complex and would not be appropriate in this summary. For more details, see http://www.voip-info.org/wiki/view/Asterisk+cmd+ZapRAS Returns -1.
This application is only intended for use with ISDN lines, and your kernel must be patched and configured to support ZapRAS(), as well as be configured to support PPP.

formalpara.title: Internal help for this application in Asterisk 1.4:

para.screen:
-= Info about application 'ZapRAS' =-
[Synopsis] Executes Zaptel ISDN RAS application
[Description] ZapRAS(args): Executes a RAS server using pppd on the given channel. The channel must be a clear channel (i.e. PRI source) and a Zaptel channel to be able to use this function (No modem emulation is included). Your pppd must be patched to be zaptel aware. Arguments should be separated by | characters.
